3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:28): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: at least around the + - signs, because otherwise you have to retokenize inside calc()

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:34): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: retokenizing in our implementation isn't that hard, because it's a hand-coded recursive descent parser and we can be mean to our tokenizer and send back pieces of tokens

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:35): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: I think WebKit uses a parser generator

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:38): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: Yeah, so in our implementation we push pieces of tokens back to the tokenizer
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (02:38): our implementation of :nth-child()
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:38): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01: I suspect Webkit tokenizes :nth-child() as one token, and then hand parses that token

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:53): howocome draws three boxes side-by-side on the board
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:53): The first box has an M followed by lines representing text
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:53): The second box has lines of text followed by a return arrow sign
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:54): The third box has an M followed by lines of text
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:54): Howcome labels the boxes 1,2,3
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:54): Howcome writes a small m at the top of 2 and crosses it out
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:55): Howcome: I think we need to resolve the page issue before deciding on the column break properties
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:55): 04c6178a6b383efd09549f9028ece8b4: The issue is, where to eliminate the top margin
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:55): Howcome: I don't think it should be eliminated at the start of the document
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:56): Howcome: The spec says the margins are eliminated at page breaks.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:56): Howcome: The question is should it be eliminated at forced breaks
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:56): Steve: THere are three cases of page breaks.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:56): Steve: page-break-before, page-break-after, and named pages
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:57): Howcome: I would be so confused by having different behavior for page-break-before and page-break-after
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:58): Steve: I am convinced that we should preserve margin on page-break-before
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (02:59): Steve: but not page-break-after
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:00): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d agrees with 04c6178a6b383efd09549f9028ece8b4
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:01): Murakami-san: I agree with 04c6178a6b383efd09549f9028ece8b4. Page-break-before and page-break-after should behave the same.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (03:01): is not in favor of printing in general :)
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:01): Steve: I want a use case for page-break-after
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (03:01): thought we were still on break
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:01): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Suppose I want to print CSS2.1 with breaks between sections and chapters
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:02): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I want page-break-before on each chapter, to separate out the chapters from each other and from the cover pages

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:03): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: but I select page-break-after for the sections, because the beginning of the chapter is usually so short, just a title and maybe a paragraph or two
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:04): discussion of use cases and margins and breaking
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:06): Steve: Ok, I can live with it
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:06): Anne: It's really annoying for projection mode that the margin is collapsed at breaks
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:07): RESOLVED: margins kept at forced breaks for page-break-before and page-break-after
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:08): what about named pages?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:09): if we collapse there, you always have the option of forcing the break to keep the margin
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:09): and you're not guaranteed a break, because elements assigned to the same name do not break in betweenm
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:11): one of the main use cases for named pages is e.g. putting a wide table onto a landscape page
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (03:15): RESOLVED: If a page-break-before, page-break-after, or use of named page forces a page break, then the margin top is preserved after the break.
